item.title: Ways Money Can Make Things Worse - EA Forum
item.description: Ways Money Can Make Things Worse - EA Forum Adverse effects of funding Individual epistemic distortion Collective epistemic and attention distortion

item.title: Making Effective Altruism Enormous - EA Forum
item.description: Making Effective Altruism Enormous - EA Forum Some criticisms of EA have been that it’s too demanding. This seems wrong. Not only do very few effective altruists embrace a maximalist and burdensome utilitarian view about ethical obligations, but we should be happy to encourage consequentialist altruistic giving across domains, even if not optimal.

item.title: 2022-07-27 Call with Alexa About Community Building
item.description: 2022-07-27 Call with Alexa About Community Building Expaining how I am [[Welfarism]] I realize that I retract half of what I said to Thomas because I thought I had to fully buy EA Ideas I really enjoyed EA ideas, then realized I didn’t buy all of them, which explains disillusionment It’s okay to make EA Mainstream We cannot to discount the power of pop culture We need soft power in pop culture I don’t buy EA values, so I can’t express EA Thomas and Matt happen to be competent, which is an issue Express concern about my long term involvement in YEA

item.title: Apology to YEA About Social Event EA Against Humanity
item.description: Apology to YEA About Social Event EA Against Humanity Holy crap My bad guys. Nothing much I can say except that I could have done a lot of a better job on that one, it was unplanned diffusion of responsibility with poor delegation on my end.

item.title: On Caring
item.description: On Caring [[Scope Insensitivity]] I’m not very good at feeling the size of large numbers. Once you start tossing around numbers larger than 1000 (or maybe even 100), the numbers just seem “big”.

item.title: [[2022-06-20]] Post About Diversity in Effective Altruism
item.description: [[2022-06-20]] Post About Diversity in Effective Altruism On the topic of diversity: YEA is one of the most diverse EA groups out there, and one of the biggest shockers for me when I first engaged with the broader EA community was the stark contrast and lack of diversity.

item.title: Physical vs. temporal or chronological distance
item.description: Physical Vs. Temporal or Chronological Distance A big issue of altruism is this idea of distance In global health, it’s physical distance But in longtermism, it’s chronological distance

item.description: The Story of a Bird and Leap of Faith One day, a small bird was flying around looking for something to do.

item.title: Two Bad Conclusions for Using a Discount Rate
item.description: Two Bad Conclusions for Using a Discount Rate Some lives are being valued less than others People in the past are going to end up way more important than present (Cleopatra would be more important than all humans)

item.title: What about pastism—are we properly considering interests of the past in current society
item.description: What About pastism—are We Properly Considering Interests of the Past in Current Society Why: instead of starting here and thinking forward to future, start from past and think forward to present.
